pr_title: Query_Breakdown: New Query Breaking Down Logic Implemented, Multi-line deletion implemented, Replacement Logic randomized

timeline.message: query_breakdown locationtracker now works with replacement
stack now works to rearrange output order
test case for deletion and replacement at the same time added
json flag added as well as variable programmed
works as a stand-alone jar file now
integration is now finished and working!
code cleaned up for pull request
empty and singleton files EOF are now supported
fixed bugs for EOF, no options, bracket options
added pair class, began changing locationtracker to pair
location tracking now works with multi-line deletion

Revert "input reader new design sketched"

This reverts commit 0b4ec37b878e492b3bc4cdbc2ec3fe9776135249.
input reader location tracking design complete
query breakdown tests now all pass
code cleaned-up and documentation added for PR

timeline.bodyText: Please add a comment to explain what's the purpose of n.
timeline.author: feiling
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -9,23 +10,50 @@
 
   /**
    * Given a component, provides a recommendation as to which component the input should be
-   * replaced with. Returns a list of components that it recommends.
+   * replaced with. Returns a list of components that it recommends. The default method of
+   * choosing recommendations is through randomization.
    *
    * We choose ArrayLists as the data structure because we want to impose a certain ordering
    * with the recommendations: certain recommendations should be "better" than others
+   *
+   * n is an integer that controls the number of replacement options
    */
   public static ArrayList<String> replace (String component, ArrayList<String> options) {
-    // simply returns the first n options

timeline.author: feiling
